answers.answer: Hi!If you are pregnant for first time at 42 years, then you need to be under gynecological care right from day 1. You may need hormone replacement therapy for about 3 months. Also you will need antenatal genetic and other testing to rule out common anomalies in baby that is common in first pregnancies at this age. Chances of high BP and diabetes during pregnancy are also high. So for a successful pregnancy it will have to be rigorously managed by an expert. All the best! Take care!

question: Hi I am 42 and this is my first pregnancy.  I found out two weeks ago and had blood work that my progestrone is low the Dr. put me on Progestrone Supp.  All my symptoms went away.  Today I have some brown discharge and mild pain (almost like ovulation).  I do have PCOS and am frightened that I will miscarry.  I have my first Dr. appointment on Wed. I hope the ultrasound comes out OK.  This is upsetting.Thanks AnnJ42
title: 5 Weeks and Brown Spotting
